getCountrybbox.json@174|data>getCountryP.description: ISO3 country code for country of interest. For a list of ISO3 country codes, look [here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_3166_country_codes). This will be used as the study area. *MUST BE IN EUROPE
getCountrybbox.json@174|data>getCountryP.label: ISO3 country code

VegIndexMax>VegIndexMax.yml@170|study_ar.description: Custom polygon of the study area of interest. To be used if you have not selected a country/region.
VegIndexMax>VegIndexMax.yml@170|study_ar.label: Polygon of study area

pipeline@175.label: Coordinate reference system
pipeline@175.description: The coordinate reference system of the study area. This must be a projected CRS (in meters). You can search for EPSG codes by country [here](https://epsg.io/).

VegIndexMax>VegIndexMax.yml@170|end_date.description: End date for which summarizing NDVI.
VegIndexMax>VegIndexMax.yml@170|end_date.label: End date

VegIndexMax>VegIndexMax.yml@170|spatial_.description: Spatial resolution, in meters, of the raster for plotting, leave blank to have the original spatial resolution of the layer (10m x 10m).
VegIndexMax>VegIndexMax.yml@170|spatial_.label: Spatial resolution

pipeline@172.label: Vegetation indices
pipeline@172.description: Vegetation Indices that should be extracted.

pipeline@172|default_output.description: Vegetation Indices that should be extracted.
pipeline@172|default_output.label: Vegetation indices

VegIndexMax>VegIndexMax.yml@170|rasters.description: Raster the maximum Vegetation index value for each pixel within the time span choosen. If multiple indices were chosen, each band corresponds to a different vegetation index
VegIndexMax>VegIndexMax.yml@170|rasters.label: Vegetation index rasters

metadata.name: Maximum Vegetation Index
metadata.description: This script outputs the maximum vegetation index value for every pixel within a given region and for a selected time period over all Copernicus Vegetation Index layers available using OpenEO on the Copernicus Dataspace Ecosystem. This data is currently only available for Europe. The resulting raster image is normally a cloud-free and directly interpretable vegetation index layer. You can read more about the NDVI layers [here](https://land.copernicus.eu/en/dataset-catalog).
